Comment_contributor: “In these mo may be the word mo “only,” and nou and rere the true numerals.”
(little finger of left hand) “In counting, parts of the body are used as tallies. The sequence is thus given by the late Rev. J. Chalmers.”
“Cf. no-rere, both; le’ere, pair, and the dual pronouns enere, norere and orere.”
(thumb) [cf. karina ‘thumb’ in Rev. J. H. Holmes’s vocabulary]
(wrist) [cf. eve ke ‘wrist’ in Rev. J. H. Holmes’s vocabulary]
(elbow) [cf. eve kau ‘elbow’ in Rev. J. H. Holmes’s vocabulary]
(shoulder) [cf. ara ‘shoulder-bland’ in Rev. J. H. Holmes’s vocabulary]
(neck) [cf. ano ‘collar-bone’ in Rev. J. H. Holmes’s vocabulary]
(left breast) [cf. ame ‘breast’ in Rev. J. H. Holmes’s vocabulary]
(chest) [cf. u’ukane ‘chest’ in Rev. J. H. Holmes’s vocabulary]
(right breast) [cf. mekaimekai ‘half’ in Rev. J. H. Holmes’s vocabulary]
